I urge all leaders of Zambia to respect the will of the people and channel any grievances and concerns through prescribed legal channels.

#AoVivo: President Dilma announces Message to the Federal Senate and the Brazilian People https://t.co/Hxf78x9FSe
My return to the Presidency, by decision of the Senate, will mean the affirmation of the Democratic State of Right.
We need to strengthen democracy in our country and, for this, it will be necessary for the Senate to close the process of impeachment in progress (...)
(...) recognizing, in the face of irrefutable evidence, that there was no crime of responsibility. That I'm innocent.
It is not legitimate to dismiss the president for the "whole of the work". Who pushes the president away for the "whole of the work" is the people, in the elections.
Consumed the impeachment without crime of responsibility, we would have a coup d'etat.
The electoral college of 110 million voters would be replaced, without constitutional support, by an electoral college of 81 senators.
It would be an unequivocal coup followed by indirect election.
I understand that the solution to the political and economic crises we face is through popular vote in direct elections.
Democracy is the only way to build a Pact for National Unity, Development and Social Justice.
I will give my unrestricted support to the convening of a plebiscite, with the aim of consulting the population about the early conduct of elections.
We must build a broad National Pact, based on free and direct elections, that involves all Brazilian citizens.
A Pact that strengthens the values ​​of the Democratic State of Law, national sovereignty, economic development and social achievements.
The transition to this new democratic moment requires that a broad dialogue be opened among all the living forces of the Brazilian Nation.
Another health insurer is pulling back due to 'persistent financial losses on #Obamacare plans.' Only the beginning! https://t.co/YqfaEvg8c3
We must not allow a possible rupture of the democratic order based on impeachment without crime, weaken our democracy (...)
(...) with the sacrifice of the rights guaranteed in the Constitution of 1988.
This process of impeachment is fragile, legally inconsistent, an unfair process, unleashed against an honest and innocent person.
I ask the senators not to do the injustice of condemning me for a crime I do not commit. Ñ ​​there is injustice + devastating than condemning an innocent
My hope exists because it is also the democratic hope of the Brazilian people, who elected me twice as president.
Who is to decide the future of the Country is our people. Democracy will win.
Read the entire message to the Federal Senate and the Brazilian people: https://t.co/gtG1gt4qg7
